Reviews.Title: Upgraded to Android 4.0.4 ICS, works in T&T;
Reviews.Author: Aleem M
Reviews.Content: For the price and feature set, it's hard to find a better positioned mobile device. There is an LG issued firmware update to Android 4.0.4 Ice Cream Sandwich, this does not void your warranty. I updated in 5 minutes using SmartFlash. This makes the interface faster and more intuitive, too many improvements to list. It really breathes new life into the device and leapfrogs many in the market.Battery life is suitable for my usage.Another major consideration was the network bands. In Trinidad and Tobago carriers use 850/1900 bands for voice and data respectively. It's important to note that the black version of this phone does not meet those requirements. Only the white will work.In total it worked out to 1500 TTD including skybox costs.

Reviews.Title: Mint condition-Very good buy
Reviews.Author: Azael O.
Reviews.Content: The phone came in a very nice condition, came in a Generic Motorola box, not original packaging tho, just a generic fitting. If you are looking to get an original OEM box with your product you might not be so lucky, however the phone its in great condition, came with Android 2.3.4 , it didn't come completely unlocked, I used 2 different international SIM cards and they did not detect, I did a wipe out, then  after it reboot I then checked for updates using the LG MOBILE SUPPORT TOOL,it found an update to ICS, went for it, and after it it was completely unlocked, both  SIM were detected working flawlessly.I was pretty lucky to not mess too much with installing things manually.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for the price????
Reviews.Author: Dad in San Diego
Reviews.Content: Okay, below was my first impression, but after a two weeks the touch-pad buttons would not work which made the phone almost useless without constantly resetting it. LG support was a pain to deal with regarding this (would not support international phones, etc.). I kept trying to work it out because the phone looked so good for the price, but really after a month it was clear that it was a malfunctioning piece of junk. Luckily the amazon folks were very cool and took it back.OLD & Inaccurate review:Of course, it isn't the most cutting edge, but it has a great looking screen and, for the price, it certainly does enough.Cautions:1. It does not come with a very current version of Android, but this link gives directions on how to update it: [...]2. No SD memory card provided, you will need to order your own, but these are very cheap so its not a deal-breaker.3. I received an international charger (I am in the US).  Its not a big deal because the phone allows for USB charging too, so maybe its a bonus for when I travel?I haven't had the phone for long, so I'll share more when  I can.
